inclusion.criterion: Symptomatic chronic heart failure, New York Heart Association (NYHA) class II to IIIb
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Left ventricular ejection fraction of 0.35 due to non-ischemic etiology
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Evidence by transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) of moderate or severe MR without obvious primary mitral valve pathology
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Peak VO2 less than or equal to 22 ml/kg/min, as obtained at study entry
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Optimal heart failure therapy for at least 6 months prior to study entry
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Significant coronary artery disease (greater than 75% lesion in any vessel) by coronary angiography or by a history of a prior heart attack
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Heart failure due to active myocarditis, congenital heart disease, or obstructive hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Primary MR due to significant chordal or leaflet abnormalities by TTE
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Other hemodynamically relevant stenotic or regurgitant valvular diseases
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has Marfan's syndrome and known severe mitral valve prolapse with regurgitation, who was planned for a MV repair but was lost to follow-up. She remains symptomatic and is now prepared to undergo mitral valve repair/replacement surgery.
